title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7025.2 - Incoming prisoner packages
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7025.2 - Incoming prisoner packages

State Regulations
(a) The
chief administrative officer shall maintain a list of items prisoners may
receive. (b) As used in this Part, the term contraband shall mean any item in an incoming prisoner package which
constitutes a threat to the safety, security or good order of a facility, or
the health of any individual, or any item not permitted pursuant to
subdivisions (a) and (d) of this section or any item which may constitute a
criminal offense or may be the fruits or instruments of a crime. (c) Upon admission to the facility, prisoners
shall be provided with a copy of the list referenced in subdivision (a) of this
section. (d) In his or her
discretion, the chief administrative officer may require that the contents of
any incoming prisoner package be purchased from, and mailed to the facility by, a company whose ordinary business includes the sale and shipping of such
items. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
7025.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
